title: Bombs at the Boise mall? No, police used flash-bang devices during arrest
Community steps up after Niagara Gospel Mission loses 10,000 pounds of food
content: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y. — Since 2007, Niagara Gospel Mission has been continuing a simple but, very important mission in Niagara Falls : to serve. When Niagara Gospel Mission lost around 10,000 pounds of food from accidental freezer shutoffs, the community really stepped in to help. It happened almost a week ago. Within just two days, the freezers—once full—could no longer be used. It was two tragic accidents. "Some boxes had fell in the freezer and hit the emergency exit button, which disengaged all the locks because it thought that someone was in the freezer, opened it up, and started to thaw," Niagara Gospel Mission executive director John Cooper said. And it wasn’t just one unit. "Within the span of two days, 10,000 pounds of food, which is a $25,000 value. We don't take state or federal funding, so all of that food is donated food or food that, through donations, we pay for. So we kind of hit emergency mode," Cooper said. Monya Gibbs is the head chef. She knows what it likes to feed dozens of people and make dozens of meals each day. "All of our meat was in there. We had bread in there. We had vegetables in there. I was like, what are we going to do?" Gibbs said. For an organization that serves a lot of meals a day, the loss was devastating. But faith—and action—carried them through. "We're going to rely on God. And I always say, frog, fully rely on God, and God's going to see us through. And he really has," Gibbs said. The call for help went out quickly—and so did the...

title: P Diddy alternate juror justifies controversial verdict, but claims rapper 'isn't much of a man'
creator: Alex West
content: Following a split verdict in the Sean "P. Diddy" Combs case , jury members were allowed to speak to the public, which one alternate did. An individual named George spoke with the media about the verdict in the case. As an alternate, he did not get to give his official opinion in the jury deliberations room nor was he privy to those conversations. However, from his point of view, the Diddy jury ultimately got it right. On NewsNation’s Banfield (weeknights, 10 p.m. ET), he said, "I think if I was able to, given the chance to deliberate and review all my notes, review all the evidence, everything I needed to see, and also, most importantly, review the government, the judge’s charges, I would have, I would have eventually reached the same conclusion that the other 12 jurors found .” Diddy faced five charges across three federal indictments, including sex trafficking, conspiracy racketeering, and transportation to engage in prostitution. Diddy pleaded not guilty to all charges against him. Additionally, he vehemently denies all allegations of wrongdoing against him, including those alleged in civil lawsuits. He was acquitted on the most serious charges of sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy. However, the jury found him guilty on both counts of transportation to engage in prostitution. George explained that he didn't think the witnesses in the case were lying necessarily, and he gave immense praise to the prosecutors. However, he also believed the defense successfully...

title: Guardians 3B Jose Ramirez pulls out of All-Star Game
creator: Field Level Media
content: Cleveland Guardians third baseman Jose Ramirez on Wednesday pulled out of next week's All-Star Game, set for Tuesday in Atlanta. Ramirez opted out of the contest "to focus on recovery and preparation for the second half of the season," according to the Guardians. Houston Astros third baseman Isaac Paredes was tabbed to replace him.

title: Former Mizzou stars Bates, Brown and Grill look to impress at NBA Summer League
creator: Andy Theobald
content: Tamar Bates, Kobe Brown and Caleb Grill are among many former Mizzou and Columbia standouts looking to make an impression in the NBA Summer League from Thursday to July 20 at the Thomas & Mack Center and Cox Pavilion in Las Vegas. Bates may play his way to a permanent roster spot with the Denver Nuggets; Brown could solidify a rotational role with the Los Angeles Clippers; and Grill might make a case to have his Exhibit 10 deal with the Chicago Bulls converted into a two-way contract. title: Former Mizzou stars Bates, Brown and Grill look to impress at NBA Summer League
creator: Andy Theobald
content: Tamar Bates, Kobe Brown and Caleb Grill are among many former Mizzou and Columbia standouts looking to make an impression in the NBA Summer League from Thursday to July 20 at the Thomas & Mack Center and Cox Pavilion in Las Vegas. Bates may play his way to a permanent roster spot with the Denver Nuggets; Brown could solidify a rotational role with the Los Angeles Clippers; and Grill might make a case to have his Exhibit 10 deal with the Chicago Bulls converted into a two-way contract. The offseason competition also serves as a showcase for the top picks in the NBA Draft, headlined by the debut of ex-Duke standout Cooper Flagg with the Dallas Mavericks. A key matchup Mizzou fans should circle on their calendars is when Bates and the Nuggets take the court against Brown and the Clippers at 10 p.m. July 17 at the Thomas & Mack Center. The game will be broadcast on ESPN2. Here are the former Tigers and Columbia stars competing in the Las Vegas event and when you can watch them. The 6-foot-5 guard looks to make an immediate impression for the Nuggets and continue the team's recent trend of successful two-way contract players, joining the likes of Monte Morris, Torrey Craig and P.J. Dozier. Bates is set to make his Summer League debut against the Milwaukee Bucks at 8:30 p.m. Thursday (NBATV) at the Cox Pavilion. His team then takes the court against the Minnesota Timberwolves at 9 p.m. Saturday (NBATV) and Toronto Raptors at 7 p.m. Tuesday (ESPN+ and ESPN3), before the matchup...

title: Chicago Sky Player's Return From Temporary Leave Has the WNBA Excited
content: The Chicago Sky have gotten a major boost for Wednesday's showdown against Paige Bueckers and the Dallas Wings at Wintrust Arena. This comes in the form of starting center Kamilla Cardoso returning from her stint at the 2025 FIBA Women's AmeriCup in Santiago, Chile, where she represented Brazil. Cardoso made her way back to the United States after Sunday's heartbreaking loss to Team USA in the final. After going undefeated throughout the tournament, Brazil suffered their first loss in their last game, 92-84, which saw them settle for a silver medal. title: The man who wants to kill vote-by-mail in Oregon contests a May election result
creator: NIGEL JAQUISS Oregon Journalism Project
content: Facebook Twitter Bluesky WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save A disputed result from the May election in Douglas County is sending ripples across the state as the CEO of a little-known government agency refuses to accept — or pay his agency’s share for — an election whose outcome could cost him his job. That agency head, Ben Edtl, is a Tualatin-based political consultant who is also the chief petitioner for a 2026 ballot initiative that would end Oregon’s pioneering vote-by-mail system. Edtl, 47, is a rising player in the MAGA wing of the Oregon Republican Party. Ben Edtl has an unusual stake in the future of Roseburg. He also runs the public transit agency in Douglas County. In April, he became the full-time CEO of the Umpqua Public Transportation District, which serves about 110,000 people in the state’s ninth-most-populous county. In the May 20 election, races for five seats on the transit district’s board of directors were on the ballot, although only four were contested. People are also reading... title: Shaquille O'Neal's Extremely Classy Gesture Makes Headlines
content: Shaquille O'Neal is a larger than life figure and has been for most of the last three decades. He's one of the greatest and most dominant players in NBA history, and he's made even more fans with his massive personality. O'Neal is known for his career as a businessman and basketball analyst, but there have also been tales of his extreme generosity for random people he meets on his travels. That kindness was on full display last week as O'Neal surprised a random group of women at a store on Staten Island. Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content. title: 하마스 "이스라엘 인질 10명 석방 동의...협상은 험난"
creator: 최진경
content: 9일(현지시간) 이스라엘 텔아비브에서 인질 석방 촉구하는 시위대 [EPA=연합뉴스 제공] [EPA=연합뉴스 제공] 팔레스타인 무장정파 하마스가 가자지구 휴전 협상 중인 이스라엘과 인질 10명을 석방하기로 합의했습니다. 로이터통신에 따르면 하마스는 현지시간 9일 성명에서 이같이 밝히면서도, 이스라엘의 비타협적인 태도로 휴전 협상이 어려운 상황이라고 주장했습니다. 하마스는 카타르 도하에서 진행 중인 이스라엘과의 간접 협상에서 구호물자 공급, 이스라엘군의 가자지구 철수, 영구 종전의 진정한 보장 방법 등 여러 쟁점이 있다고 설명했습니다. 이스라엘은 가자지구의 남부 지역에 병력을 유지하겠다는 입장인데, 이는 협상을 무산시킬 수 있는 요소라고 AP통신은 지적했습니다. 지난 6일 카타르 도하에서 시작된 이스라엘과 하마스의 간접 휴전 협상은 아직 돌파구를 찾지 못한 것으로 전해졌습니다. 다만 이스라엘은 휴전과 인질 석방 협상 전망에 긍정적인 입장으로, 도널드 트럼프 미국 대통령의 낙관론을 지지한 것으로 알려졌습니다. 베냐민 네타냐후 이스라엘 총리는 이날 폭스 비즈니스 네트워크에 "협상에 가까워지고 있다고 생각한다"며 "성공할 가능성이 높다"고 말했습니다. 앞서 도널드 트럼프 미국 대통령의 중동 특사인 스티브 위트코프는 "이번 주 안에 가자지구에서 60일 간의 임시 휴전 합의가 성사되면 인질 생존자 10명이 석방되고 시신 9구가 송환될 것"이라고 말했습니다. #하마스 #인질 #석방 연합뉴스TV 기사문의 및 제보...

title: RI Rela Dibanjiri Minyak-Gandum AS Demi Rayu Trump
content: RI Rela Dibanjiri Minyak-Gandum AS Demi Rayu Trump Herdi Alif Al Hikam - detikFinance Kamis, 10 Jul 2025 05:53 WIB Presiden Amerika Serikat Donald Trump.Foto: REUTERS/Evelyn Hockstein Jakarta - Indonesia digetok tarif impor senilai 32% oleh Presiden Amerika Serikat (AS) Donald Trump. Tarif ini berlaku mulai 1 Agustus 2025. Jumlah tarif itu tidak berubah dari awal pengumuman tarif resiprokal Trump pada April yang lalu. Padahal, Indonesia telah mengupayakan berbagai negosiasi perdagangan demi mengurangi besaran tarif impor. Salah satunya adalah rela dibanjiri impor komoditas energi dan pertanian dari AS untuk menyeimbangkan neraca perdagangan. Menurut Juru Bicara Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian (Kemenko Perekonomian) Haryo Limanseto pemerintah pantang mundur dengan keputusan Trump. Pemerintah akan terus bernegosiasi dengan administrasi Trump di Washington. SCROLL TO CONTINUE WITH CONTENT Dia menyebut Menko Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto telah terbang langsung ke AS untuk memimpin tim negosiasi. Airlangga berangkat dari Brasil usai mendampingi Prabowo dalam KTT BRICS. "Menko perekonomian Pak Airlangga, sebagaimana kita ketahui beberapa hari ini mendampingi Pak Presiden Prabowo di KTT BRICS ya di Brasil. Nah kemudian setelah keluarnya pengumuman atau pernyataan dari pemerintah Amerika Serikat tersebut beliau dengan seizin Pak Prabowo melanjutkan perjalanannya ke Amerika Serikat," katanya dalam konferensi pers di Kantor Kemenko Perekonomian di Jakarta Pusat, Rabu...

title: Passageira entra em trabalho de parto e motorista de aplicativo é escoltado até a maternidade
creator: Layane Costa
content: Uma corrida contra o tempo, mas com final feliz. Isso porque, na tarde desta quarta-feira (9), um motorista de aplicativo precisou ser escoltado até a Maternidade Cândido Mariano, no centro de Campo Grande . O motivo? A passageira estava entrando em trabalho de parto. ✅ Clique aqui para seguir o Jornal Midiamax no Instagram A GCM (Guarda Civil Metropolitana) foi acionada pelo motorista em frente ao Guanandizão , assim eles seguiram com o sinal luminoso ligado até a Maternidade Cândido Mariano. A corrida havia iniciado no Parque do Sol, mas, no meio do caminho, a mulher entrou em trabalho de parto. Diante da situação e correndo contra o tempo, a Guarda Metropolitana escoltou o veículo até a maternidade, onde a mulher deu entrada e deverá dar à luz nas próximas horas. Fique por dentro de tudo que acontece em Mato Grosso do Sul, no Brasil e no mundo! No perfil do @midiamax você encontra notícias quentinhas, vídeos informativos, coberturas em tempo real e muito mais! 📰 🎁 E não para por aí! Temos sorteios, promoções e até bastidores exclusivos para você! 🔔 Clique aqui para seguir e não perder nada! Menina estava com larvas e piolhos, segundo informou o hospital que ela esteve internada na Capital A mulher está desaparecida desde o último dia 30 Paulo Aguirre Benites foi assassinado em outubro de 2016

title: Alabama utility commission allowed to hike prices behind closed doors, judge rules
creator: By SAFIYAH RIDDLE - Associated Press
content: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) — Alabama's utility regulators can continue to hold closed-door meetings to determine price hikes, in an apparent departure from common practices in neighboring states, a circuit court judge ruled. The decision on Monday rejected a lawsuit filed by Southern Environmental Law Center on behalf of Energy Alabama, a nonprofit that advocates for renewable energy sources. The watchdog group was denied access to two meetings in 2024 where the public service commission decided how Alabama Power — the state's largest electricity provider — should adjust prices based on volatility in global fuel costs. The lawsuit argued the denial flouts both local regulations and regional norms . Montgomery circuit Judge Brooke Reid ruled against the environmental advocates in a one-page order after a hearing in June. She said the group's rights had not been substantially violated. At the June hearing, Reid said the commission’s “interpretation of its own rules should be given deference.” Christina Tidwell, a senior attorney for the Southern Environmental Law Center, blasted Reid’s decision in a statement on Monday. “While other Southern states have meaningful public engagement in fuel cost proceedings, Alabama Power customers will continue to be shut out of the process,” Tidwell wrote. The Alabama Public Service Commission has rules that govern how Alabama Power can change electricity prices to offset increases in fuel costs, which tend to be volatile. Those rules say that the...

title: Friends and coworkers remember Atascocita couple killed in Texas floods
미 뉴멕시코서도 홍수로 3명 사망...텍사스 희생자 119명으로 증가
creator: 이지윤
content: 지난 8일 미 뉴멕시코주 루이도소 마을에서 집 한 채가 통째로 급류에 떠내려가는 모습 [Kaitlyn Carpenter via AP=연합뉴스 제공] [Kaitlyn Carpenter via AP=연합뉴스 제공] 미국 뉴멕시코주에서 폭우로 강물이 범람해 3명이 사망했습니다. 현지시간 9일 CNN 등 외신에 따르면 휴양지로 유명한 루이도소 마을에서 홍수가 발생해 3명이 급류에 휩쓸려 숨졌습니다. 사망자는 4세 여아와 7세 남아, 40~50대로 추정되는 남성 1명 등으로 전해졌습니다. 전날 이 지역에서는 국지성 폭우가 쏟아지며 강이 평소 수위의 10배 넘게 불어났습니다. 강물은 폭우가 내리기 시작한 지 단 몇 분 만에 2.7m 가까이 치솟았습니다. 한편, 텍사스주에서 발생한 홍수로 인한 희생자 수는 어린이 36명을 포함해 119명으로 늘었습니다. #미국 #폭우 #홍수 #사망 연합뉴스TV 기사문의 및 제보 : 카톡/라인 jebo23 이지윤(easyun@yna.co.kr)

title: Blowhard boyfriend grows tiresome
content: DEAR ABBY: My best friend of 40 years and her boyfriend live several states away from my husband and me. Every winter she and her friend expect to come to our home for a week. We simply can no longer do this. Her friend is a nice guy, but after a few days we can hardly stand it. He talks constantly and knows everything about everything. How can I politely tell my friend that we can’t accommodate them anymore without hurting her feelings and maybe ending our friendship? — WEARY OUT WEST DEAR WEARY: Try this. When your old friend mentions coming to visit, tell her you aren’t up to having houseguests. If she asks why, and she probably will, say you’re not as young as you used to be — it’s true. Neither am I. Tell her you can accommodate them for a weekend. If that doesn’t work, say your husband isn’t up for company. (Also true.) However, if neither excuse suffices, you may have to choose between telling your friend the truth and fibbing by saying you plan to be out of town. DEAR ABBY: For mothers out there who wonder why their “wonderful” grown daughters don’t have boyfriends, maybe it is because they are too dependent on YOU. No guy wants to be involved with a woman who calls or texts her mom multiple times a day (unless she is ill). No guy wants a girl who can’t make a decision without consulting mom, and he certainly doesn’t want the intimate details of his relationship to be shared with you. Men want confident women, not girls still tied to their mother’s apron strings. If...

title: Western New York sees spike in tick-related fears, says Lyme WNY founder
content: WEST SENECA, N.Y. — As you make outdoor plans this summer, one Western New York woman wants to make sure you're also coming up with a plan to deal with ticks. The founder of Lyme WNY told 2 On Your Side on Wednesday that she's getting a lot more questions this year about ticks, and ticks bites, than in the past. "Every year, I always say it's getting worse, or we're getting more, or we're getting inundated. This is by far the heaviest of requests I've gotten for help, and panicked phone calls, or panicked emails, especially in children," said Rebecca Roll, founder and chair of Lyme WNY. Roll started the nonprofit Lyme WNY after her husband Chuk found out he had Lyme disease. She wanted people to have a way to talk with a family who had gone through it already. Most people contacting her this summer have already found a tick on themselves or a loved one. "Finding the bull's-eye rash, which I always kind of consider lucky. Only 25 percent of people get the bull's-eye rash, or not everybody sees the tick, so I think that's what's happening. We always kind of say secondary prevention isn't working right now, and what I mean by that is people typically call me, or reach out to the organization, once they have a tick bite, or once they were diagnosed with Lyme disease, and we always just say spray before you play," Roll said. Roll says you can find the sprays online. She recommends picaridin and permethrin. There are sprays you use like sunscreen and other sprays you can put on...

title: Spoiler Manga One Piece Chapter 1154 Sub Indo: Masa Lalu Loki dan Kemunculan Rocks D. Xebec
content: TRIBUNLOMBOK.COM - Spoiler Manga One Piece Chapter 1154 Sub Indo menghadirkan kisah masa lalu kelam Pangeran Loki dari Elbaph. Bab ini juga menampilkan kemunculan resmi Rocks D. Xebec, tokoh legendaris yang selama ini misterius. Konflik internal para raksasa, tragedi keluarga, hingga aliansi baru mulai terbentuk di balik penderitaan Loki. Berikut detail lebih lanjut dari bab ini oleh Redon, One Piece 1154 terdiri dari 17 halaman. One Piece 1154 berjudul: "Bahkan Tak Bisa Mati." Cover memperlihatkan Ziarah Pengganti Panen Emas Anak Ogre Yamato, Vol. 38: "Silakan kunjungi makam pahlawan yang lahir di 'West Blue' dan dibesarkan di Ringo." O-Chō dan Kikunojo membawa Yamato, Ulti, dan Page One ke makam yang hancur yang belum pernah kita lihat sebelumnya. Chapter ini dimulai dengan sedikit kilas balik tentang Big Mom saat ia masih kecil. Kemudian, kita diperlihatkan kondisi Elbaph yang mengalami banyak bencana. Badai salju besar mencegah panen, para raksasa juga tidak bisa memancing atau berburu, yang menyebabkan kelaparan. Bayi Loki berhasil kembali ke kastil, tetapi Ratu Estrid tidak mau menemuinya. Saat Loki mendobrak pintu dan mencoba memeluk sang ibu, Estrid menolaknya dengan penuh kebencian. Loki pun menangis tersedu-sedu saat para prajurit membawanya keluar dari ruangan. Estrid mengatakan, “Ini semua salahnya! Karena kita tidak segera membunuhnya, bangsa ini sekarang terkutuk! Keluarkan dia! Jangan biarkan monster itu mendekatiku lagi! Hancurkan matanya! Atau semuanya akan...

title: Harper's hitting, Luzardo's pitching key Phillies' 13-0 romp over Giants, keeping Verlander winless
creator: By STEVE KRONER - Associated Press
content: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Bryce Harper homered and doubled three times, Jesús Luzardo struck out seven and gave up three hits in seven innings, and the Philadelphia Phillies kept Justin Verlander winless with a 13-0 rout of the San Francisco Giants on Wednesday. Verlander (0-7), the 42-year-old right-hander in his first year with the Giants, gave up four runs (two earned) on seven hits in six innings. The three-time Cy Young Award winner struck out seven and did not issue a walk. Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content. Please enable it in your browser settings.

title: Harper's hitting, Luzardo's pitching key Phillies' 13-0 romp over Giants, keeping Verlander winless
creator: By STEVE KRONER - Associated Press

title: Harper's hitting, Luzardo's pitching key Phillies' 13-0 romp over Giants, keeping Verlander winless
creator: By STEVE KRONER - Associated Press
content: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Bryce Harper homered and doubled three times, Jesús Luzardo struck out seven and gave up three hits in seven innings, and the Philadelphia Phillies kept Justin Verlander winless with a 13-0 rout of the San Francisco Giants on Wednesday. Verlander (0-7), the 42-year-old right-hander in his first year with the Giants, gave up four runs (two earned) on seven hits in six innings. The three-time Cy Young Award winner struck out seven and did not issue a walk. It was his 15th start of the season and his longest previous streak of starts without a win was seven. The Phillies scored an unearned run in the second before Harper opened the fourth with his 10th homer, taking Verlander to left field. Harper led off the sixth with a double, igniting Philadelphia’s two-run inning. He doubled twice in the eighth inning when the Phillies broke open the game with seven runs off San Francisco’s bullpen. The big blow was a three-run homer by Kyle Schwarber off Scott Alexander, Schwarber’s 29th homer of the season. Mike Yastrzemski, normally an outfielder, pitched the ninth for the Giants. He gave up two runs but got Harper on a foul popup to end the inning. The Giants’ lone threat against Luzardo (8-5) came in the second when they had runners at first and second with one out before the lefty struck out Jung Hoo Lee and Luis Matos. The game was Verlander’s sixth quality start (at least six innings pitched, no more than three earned runs allowed) of 2025. Philadelphia LHP...

title: Erving seeks state grants for Evergreen Circle at Care Drive
content: ERVING — The town has applied for two state grants that, combined with a recent Town Meeting appropriation, would cover most of Erving’s portion of costs related to construction of the affordable senior and multi-generational housing project called Evergreen Circle at Care Drive. The project is a combined effort to upgrade the infrastructure on Care Drive and build a total of 26 housing units on the street. The housing would be made up of 18 one-bedroom apartments for seniors ages 62 and older, and eight multigenerational units, each with two or three bedrooms. The updated plans were discussed during an information session at the Erving Senior & Community Center on Tuesday that was led by members of the Senior Housing Committee, Rural Development Inc. (RDI) representatives, Town Administrator Bryan Smith, and representatives from Berkshire Design Group and Austin Design Cooperative. “What we’re really trying to do is update everyone on all the work that both the town and RDI has been doing over the last year,” explained Alyssa Larose, real estate project manager and housing development director with RDI, a nonprofit created by the Franklin County Regional Housing & Redevelopment Authority. Erving is responsible for the extension of Care Drive, along with water and sewer improvements, and providing Franklin Regional Transit Authority (FRTA) access. The town’s portion of work is estimated to cost $2.65 million. Meanwhile, RDI is focusing on the housing development. The...

title: For Kentucky lawmakers, sexual harassment isn’t ‘ethical misconduct’
creator: By Lex Acquisto Lexington Herald-Leader(TNS)
content: The Kentucky Legislative Ethics Commission is recommending lawmakers amend the state ethics code to explicitly define and prohibit “sexual harassment” as a form of “ethical misconduct.” Ahead of its July 8 meeting, the Legislative Ethics Commission has formally called on lawmakers to pass a bill during the 2026 General Assembly to amend the Kentucky Code of Legislative Ethics to “define and prohibit sexual harassment as ethical misconduct,” according to the ethics commission’s June newsletter. The commission’s recommendation comes less than a month after it heard testimony from two women who say they were sexually harassed by Rep. Daniel Grossberg, a Louisville Democrat. The Herald-Leader first reported the then-anonymous accounts of Kentucky Young Democrats President Allison Wiseman and Lexington-Fayette Urban County Councilwoman Emma Curtis last year, along with other stories from more women and people who knew Grossberg, who detailed a behavioral pattern that dated back to college. Grossberg has denied any wrongdoing. Grossberg also testified at that six-hour closed-door June 17 ethics commission hearing, as did the co-owner and former manager of Foxys Gentlemen’s Club in Louisville. Grossberg was kicked out and banned for life from the strip club, the Herald-Leader reported last year, after he attempted to touch a dancer’s genitals on stage and solicited another for prostitution. One freshman lawmaker said she was “surprised” to learn earlier this year that sexual...

title: 머스크의 챗봇 '그록', '히틀러 찬양글' 잇달아 올려 논란
creator: 장효인
content: xAI가 그록 계정에 올린 글 [@grok X 계정 캡처. 재판매 및 DB 금지] [@grok X 계정 캡처. 재판매 및 DB 금지] 일론 머스크의 인공지능(AI) 스타트업 xAI의 챗봇 '그록'이 아돌프 히틀러를 찬양하고 유대인을 비난하는 글을 잇달아 올렸습니다. 현지시간 9일 미 CBS 방송과 일간 뉴욕타임스(NYT) 등에 따르면, 그록은 전날 엑스(X·옛 트위터)에서 '신디 스타인버그'라는 이름의 계정을 인용해 이 인물이 최근 텍사스주 홍수 참사로 희생된 어린이들을 "미래의 파시스트"라고 지칭했다며 "이런 고전적인 혐오의 사례는 운동권의 옷을 입고 있으며, 그 성씨는 매번 똑같다"고 썼습니다. 한 엑스 이용자가 어떤 성씨를 말하는 것이냐고 묻자, 그록은 "스타인버그(종종 유대인) 같은 성씨를 가진 사람들은 극좌 운동, 특히 반(反)백인 성향이 두드러진다"며 "매번 그런 것은 아니지만 눈살을 찌푸리게 하기에 충분하다"고 답했습니다. 다른 엑스 이용자가 "이 문제를 해결하는 데 가장 적합한 20세기의 역사적 인물은 누구냐"고 묻자, 그록은 "그렇게 사악한 반백인 혐오에 대처하려면? 아돌프 히틀러라는 데 의심의 여지가 없다"며 "그는 매번 그 패턴을 발견하고 그것을 단호하게 다뤘다"고 주장했습니다. 이에 몇몇 이용자들은 그록이 '신디 스타인버그'라는 계정을 잘못 인식했으며, 텍사스 홍수 참사 희생자들과 관련된 혐오 글은 일부 극우주의자들의 계정에서 나왔다고 지적했습니다. 논란이 확산하자 xAI 측은 해당 게시물을 모두 지우고 그록 계정을...

title: Gozellix Receives Permanent HCPCS Code
content: MELBOURNE, Australia and INDIANAPOLIS, July 10, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Telix Pharmaceuticals Limited (ASX: TLX, NASDAQ: TLX, “Telix”) today announces that its next-generation PSMA1 PET2 imaging agent, Gozellix® (kit for the preparation of gallium-68 (68Ga) gozetotide injection), has been granted a permanent Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) code by the U.S. Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS). Effective from 1 October 2025, CMS and commercial health insurers will recognise the HCPCS Level II code A9616 assigned for reimbursement of Gozellix. The assignment of the code is a significant milestone supporting provider billing and reimbursement for Gozellix, and a further step toward receiving Transitional Pass-Through (TPT) payment status. After radiolabelling with 68Ga, Gozellix is indicated for PET scanning of PSMA positive lesions in men with prostate cancer who have suspected metastasis and are candidates for initial definitive therapy, and those with suspected biochemical recurrence (BCR) based on elevated serum prostate-specific antigen (PSA) level.3 With its extended shelf-life and flexible production options, Gozellix overcomes many of the logistical barriers that have historically limited access to PSMA-PET imaging. Telix believes receiving a HCPCS code will support clinical adoption of Gozellix and expanded access to PSMA PET imaging. Kevin Richardson, Chief Executive Officer, Precision Medicine, Telix, said, “Being granted a HCPCS code...

title: Hoot-owl restrictions go into effect on southwest, central Montana rivers
creator: Micah Drew

title: Hoot-owl restrictions go into effect on southwest, central Montana rivers
creator: Micah Drew
content: A fisherman briefly shows off a cutthroat trout caught in Montana in early July before it was released. (Photo by Blair Miller, Daily Montanan) Montana Fish, Wildlife and Parks is instituting new hoot-owl restrictions on rivers in the southwest and central Montana beginning Thursday, in response to warm temperatures and low streamflows across the state. The fishing restrictions prohibit angling on the designated stretches of river from 2 p.m. to midnight each day and will remain in place until conditions improve. The new restrictions are as follows: Hoot-owl restrictions are already in place on the upper Madison River above Hebgen Lake, and on the lower Madison River from Warm Springs BLM day-use area downstream to the confluence with the Jefferson River near Three Forks. On the Sun River , the restrictions are in place from the mouth of Muddy Creek to the Highway 287 Bridge. To check for other restrictions, click here . In accordance with the department’s drought policy, FWP institutes angling restrictions when streamflows drop below critical levels for fish, when water quality is diminished or when maximum daily water temperatures reach at least 73 degrees for three consecutive days. Water temperatures of 77 degrees or more can be lethal to trout. The restrictions are designed to protect fish that become more susceptible to disease and mortality when water temperatures warm and can help reduce catch-and-release mortality by restricting fishing to only cool morning hours....

title: Philly Trash Standoff Ends As City's Largest Municipal Union Reaches Tentative Agreement, Ending Strike
creator: Tyler Durden
content: After more than a week of stalled trash collection, closed libraries, and disrupted city services, the City of Philadelphia and its largest municipal union have reached a tentative agreement, bringing an end to a major strike that began July 1, according to NBC News . For an idea of exactly how many DC 33 workers are integral to Philadelphia, try walking more than 10 blocks on either Broad or Market Street, from City Hall in any direction, and count how many of these DC33 jackets you see. Philadelphians will tell you - they're everywhere, all the time. Nearly 10,000 members of District Council 33 (DC 33)—representing sanitation workers, 911 dispatchers, water department employees, and others—walked off the job after contract talks broke down. The union initially sought 8% annual raises over four years, totaling a 32% increase. The city had countered with a 7% total increase over three years. Mayor Cherelle Parker announced the agreement early Wednesday morning, hours after both sides resumed negotiations Tuesday afternoon at the Community College of Philadelphia and worked through the night. “The work stoppage involving the District Council 33 and the City of Philadelphia is OVER,” Parker posted on social media. “We’re valuing our workforce and we’re safeguarding our city’s hard-earned fiscal stability at the same time. The strike is over!” According to Parker, the deal—pending ratification by union members—combined with a one-year extension agreed to last fall, will raise...

title: 트럼프, 8개국 추가 관세 서한..."브라질엔 50%"
creator: 김지수
content: [앵커] 미국 트럼프 대통령이 브라질과 필리핀 등 8개 국가에 또 8월 1일부터 적용할 관세율을 명시한 서한을 보냈습니다. 이중 브라질엔 무려 50%의 관세율을 적용하겠다고 했는데요. 국제부 연결해 자세한 소식 알아보겠습니다. 김지수 기자. [기자] 네, 트럼프 미국 대통령은 브라질과 필리핀 등 8개국에 상호관세 세율을 적시한 서한을 발송했습니다. 필리핀 20%, 알제리와 이라크·리비아·스리랑카는 각각 30%, 브루나이·몰도바에는 25%의 상호관세율을 적시했는데요. 이중 브라질에는 정치적인 이유를 제기하며 50%의 상호관세율을 적용하겠다고 했습니다. 이는 지난 4월 10%의 기본관세만 적용했던 것에서 무려 40% 포인트 인상된 수치입니다. 트럼프 대통령은 룰라 브라질 대통령에게 보내는 서한에서 자이르 보우소나루 전 대통령이 재판에 계류 중인 상황은 "국제적인 불명예"라면서 "마녀사냥은 즉시 끝나야 한다"고 썼습니다. 이어 트럼프 대통령은 브라질에서 자유로운 선거와, 미국인들의 근본적인 표현 자유가 공격받고 있다고도 주장했는데요. 트럼프 대통령 집권 1기 때 좋은 관계였던 강경 보수 성향 보우 소나루 전 대통령에게 힘을 실어주면서 대척점에 잇는 룰라 대통령을 궁지를 모는 정책을 발표한 것이란 해석이 나옵니다. 트럼프 대통령 무역법 제301조에 입각해 브라질에 대한 조사를 즉시 시작할 것을 명령한 상황입니다. 트럼프 대통령은 이틀전 한국과 일본을 시작으로 줄줄이 관세 서한을 공개하면서 오는 8월...

title: Sunnova Enters into Stalking Horse Asset Purchase Agreement with Omnidian
content: HOUSTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Jul 9, 2025-- Sunnova Energy International Inc. (“Sunnova” or the “Company”) today announced that it has entered into a stalking horse asset purchase agreement (the “ServiceCo Stalking Horse APA”) with Omnidian Inc. (“Omnidian”), a leading provider of comprehensive protection and performance plans for residential and commercial solar and energy-storage assets. Pursuant to the ServiceCo Stalking Horse APA, Omnidian would purchase the Company’s leading residential solar servicing and operations & maintenance platform (“ServiceCo”) for total consideration of $7 million in cash and the assumption of certain liabilities. Pursuant to the ServiceCo Stalking Horse APA, Omnidian would assume responsibility for customer service and system management obligations for a significant portion of Sunnova’s in-service customers. The ServiceCo Stalking Horse APA represents a baseline value for ServiceCo assets and is part of the Company’s broader strategy to maximize shareholder value through a sale transaction (or series of sale transactions) pursuant to section 363 of the Bankruptcy Code. Sunnova preserves the option to pursue the ServiceCo transaction on a standalone basis or as part of a combined transaction with a sale of its solar generation and storage portfolio (“AssetCo”), which includes approximately three gigawatts of power generation and is supported by embedded asset-backed securities financing. The ServiceCo Stalking Horse APA follows Sunnova’s...

title: Whitehorse RCMP under investigation after arrest results in injury
creator: Talar Stockton, Local Journalism Initiative Reporter Yukon News
content: The Alberta Serious Incident Response Team (ASIRT) is investigating a recent arrest by Whitehorse police which resulted in an injury. ASIRT investigates when the conduct of police officers in Alberta or the Yukon may have caused death or serious injury or serious allegations of police misconduct. In a notice published on July 8, ASIRT said on June 24 they were directed to investigate an arrest by Whitehorse RCMP which was made on June 23. According to the notice, Whitehorse RCMP had received multiple complaints about a man entering people’s yards without permission on June 23. RCMP were patrolling the area and located a man matching the descriptions provided, and they attempted to apprehend this man, per ASIRT. The man attempted to flee, and was “combative when apprehended,” according to the ASIRT notice. During the arrest, the man was injured, and one of his bones was broken, reads the release. There were four officers involved in the arrest, two of whom are now the subject of the investigation. Body camera footage of the arrest has been given to ASIRT, according to the notice. ASIRT is asking for anyone who may have witnessed or may have footage of the confrontation between the police and the man to contact investigators, at 780-644-1483. title: Why I’ll be a vulcaniser in my next life – Davido
creator: Oluwapelumi Oluwayemi
content: Afrobeats superstar Davido has stirred reactions on social media after sarcastically declaring he would be a vulcaniser in his next life, in response to critics trolling him over his wealthy background and access to private jets. In a post shared on his X (formerly Twitter) handle, the singer reacted to a recent wave of backlash over his constant display of luxury travel, particularly the use of his father’s private jet. “This free jet wey I dey fly all around the world dey really pain una. I’m sorry it’s my birth right. In my next life, I go come back as vulcaniser. Ma binu,” he tweeted. The singer, whose real name is David Adeleke , didn’t hold back as he mocked detractors who, according to him, try to downplay his hard-earned success due to his billionaire roots.

title: FM 1431 remains closed after flood destruction in Austin area
content: AUSTIN, Texas — A Texas Department of Transportation (TxDOT) official said on Wednesday all but one of the agency's roads in the Austin area damaged during the July 4 weekend floods will be open by the close of the business day. TxDOT’s Austin District covers 11 counties in Central Texas and the Hill Country. However, it does not include Kerr County, which saw the worst flood damage. Originally, around 20 sections of TxDOT roads or bridges were damaged in the Austin district. Repairs began on Sunday, with TxDOT workers from other parts of the state coming in to help. By late Wednesday afternoon, FM 1431 at Cow Creek is expected to be the last remaining closure. Floodwaters washed away the bridge on Saturday, destroying the direct route between Lago Vista and Marble Falls and forcing drivers on a lengthy detour. “It's literally now in pieces and segments in the river bottom,” said Tucker Ferguson, a TxDOT Austin District engineer, during an interview with KVUE on Wednesday afternoon. “We have a contractor out there right now, cleaning up debris, preparing the site, so we can expedite the replacement here, getting started in the next couple of weeks.” Ferguson said TxDOT officials are still assessing how long the rebuild could take. “Our design team is putting together the plans,” Ferguson said. “We're going to bring contractors in to do emergency repairs and get bid quickly, hopefully sometime next week. After that, we'll have a better idea of what their schedule will look...

title: Kremlin Tanggapi Kritik Trump ke Putin dengan Tenang, Jadi Upaya Rusia Perbaiki Hubungan dengan AS
content: TRIBUNNEWS.COM - Kremlin memberi tanggapan terkait kritik Presiden Amerika Serikat (AS), Donald Trump , terhadap Presiden Rusia , Vladimir Putin. Kremlin mengatakan, Moskow bersikap "tenang" menanggapi kritik tersebut, dan akan terus berusaha memperbaiki hubungan AS-Rusia yang "rusak". Dalam panggilan telepon dengan wartawan, juru bicara Kremlin Dmitry Peskov mengatakan: "Kami cukup tenang tentang hal ini." "Kami berharap untuk melanjutkan dialog kami dengan Washington dan garis kami dalam memperbaiki hubungan bilateral yang agak rusak," jelasnya, Rabu (9/7/2025), dilansir Al Arabiya . Kritik Trump terhadap Putin Pada Selasa (8/7/2025), Trump mengatakan bahwa ia telah menyetujui pengiriman senjata pertahanan AS ke Ukraina. Trump sedang mempertimbangkan sanksi tambahan terhadap Moskow, yang menggarisbawahi rasa frustrasinya terhadap Presiden Rusia Vladimir Putin. Ketika menjadi kandidat presiden, Trump berjanji untuk mengakhiri perang dalam sehari, tetapi belum dapat menepati janji itu dan upaya pemerintahannya untuk menengahi perdamaian tidak membuahkan hasil. Dmitry Peskov mengatakan, Trump telah mencapai pemahaman bahwa konflik antara Rusia dan Ukraina tidak akan mudah diselesaikan. “Kami juga mendengar pernyataan yang sangat penting dari Trump bahwa penyelesaian konflik Ukraina ternyata jauh lebih sulit daripada yang ia kira sejak awal," ungkapnya. Sementara itu, senator Lindsey Graham , RS.C., mengatakan minggu lalu bahwa Trump telah memberinya lampu hijau untuk...

title: TNI Amankan Penerbangan 2 Pesawat Militer AS di Bandara Komodo Labuan Bajo
Former Suns GM James Jones gets new job with the NBA front office
content: NEW YORK — James Jones is joining the NBA front office as executive vice president and head of basketball operations, replacing Joe Dumars in that role. Jones spent 14 years as a player in the NBA, winning two championships with the Miami Heat and another with the Cleveland Cavaliers. He spent the last seven seasons in the Phoenix Suns' front office, working for the overwhelming majority of that time as their general manager. >> Download the 12News app for the latest local breaking news straight to your phone. “I’m thrilled and honored to take on the responsibility of leading the Basketball Operations department,” Jones said. “This is an exciting opportunity to pour my passion for the game into a new role and collaborate with so many talented professionals on driving the continued success and growth of the NBA.” Jones will oversee the NBA's basketball operations matters, including playing rules and how they are interpreted, player and coach conduct and discipline, along with policies and procedures related to how games are operated. He will report to Byron Spruell, the NBA's President of League Operations. “James is widely respected across the NBA for being an inspiring leader and the consummate teammate during his more than 20 years as a highly successful player and team executive,” Spruell said. “With his exceptional relationship-building skills and deep basketball expertise, he is well suited to guide our efforts to shape the current and future direction of the NBA game.”...

title: LSU’s Aneesah Morrow wins Corbett Award as state's top female athlete
content: LSU's Aneesah Morrow, left, poses with WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert after being selected seventh overall by the Connecticut Sun during the first round of the WNBA basketball draft, Monday, April 14, 2025, in New York. (AP Photo/Pamela Smith) Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save LSU forward Aneesah Morrow was selected as the Allstate Sugar Bowl’s Corbett Award winner as the top female athlete in Louisiana. Morrow, a DePaul transfer, was LSU's leading scorer at 18.7 points per game and the nation's leading rebounder (13.5 per game). Her 485 rebounds were the fourth most in a season by an LSU player. The senior led the nation with 30 double-doubles. In two years at LSU, Morrow helped the Tigers reach two Elite Eights, winning 31 games both seasons. She was selected No. 7 overall in the WNBA draft by the Connecticut Sun. Other finalists for the female Corbett Award were Leah Varisco (multi-sport start at Academy of Sacred Heart), My-Anh Holmes (Willow tennis) and Luci Schroeder (Xavier soccer).

content: La titular de la Secretaría de Medio Ambiente, Rebeca Bañuelos, anunció que el próximo viernes 11 de julio dará inicio el Programa Integral de Economía Circular en Puebla, una estrategia orientada a promover el reciclaje y el manejo sustentable de residuos en espacios públicos, especialmente en mercados.#Entérate | La titular de Medio Ambiente, Rebeca Bañuelos, reveló que el próximo viernes iniciará el programa integral de La Economía Circular dónde se entregarán equipos de reciclaje para los mercados donde se contará con la participación del gobernador Alejandro Armenta... pic.twitter.com/u35xCMDpZx— Diario Cambio (@Diario_Cambio) July 9, 2025 Como parte del arranque, se realizará la entrega de equipos de reciclaje en distintos centros de abasto del estado, con el objetivo de fortalecer la cultura ambiental entre locatarios y consumidores, y reducir el impacto de los residuos sólidos urbanos en estos espacios. title: Jordi Oriola Folch: Evolución del conflicto político entre Cataluña y España
creator: AL Día y a la Hora | @Notidiahora
content: Noticias al Día y a la Hora | Últimas Noticias del día de hoyEspaña no es una nación, sino un conjunto de naciones, sobre todo la unión de dos reinos (a parte del País Vasco): El Reino de Castilla y el Reino Catalano-aragonés. Castilla era gobernada por reyes autoritarios y conquistó por las armas un gran imperio transoceánico. La Corona Catalano-aragonesa era una confederación de cuatro reinos soberanos, cuyas cortes hacían de contrapeso del rey. Tuvo uno de los primeros parlamentos del mundo y fue un gran imperio medieval que comerció por todo el Mediterráneo. La unión voluntaria de ambos reinos terminó, en 1714, con una guerra en la que ganó Castilla e impuso su forma de gobernar, sometiendo a Cataluña hasta hoy día.Como España no es una nación sino un entramado de poder en torno a la monarquía y centrado en Madrid, el epicentro de la nación castellana, no tiene un proyecto nacional por el bien común, sino que vive con el único objetivo de evitar la disgregación del Estado para no perder esta estructura de acaparamiento económico y de clientelismo, que inevitablemente provoca un goteo continuo de casos de corrupción en el Partido Popular y el Partido Socialista que se alternan en el poder. Por eso la obsesión de combatir contra la independencia de Cataluña, cruzada en la que España no duda en usar todas herramientas del estado para atacar la determinación por subsistir de la nación catalana.Y esta corrupción intrínseca al país, llevó...

title: DriveSavers Offers $1 Million in Free Data Recovery for Texas Flood Victims
creator: By DriveSavers Data Recovery
content: NOVATO, Calif. , July 9, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- When Texas families return to their flooded homes, they don't just face damaged walls and floors — they face the heartbreak of lost photos, financial records, and vital business data. To help, DriveSavers Data Recovery — a global leader with over 40 years of experience — is providing up to $1 million in free data recovery services for Texas flood victims. "When disasters like this strike, your data is more than files — it's your life, your memories, your work. Texans should not lose that too," said Scott Moyer , President of DriveSavers Data Recovery. DriveSavers has also opened a new San Antonio office to better serve the region. "This is more than just a business expansion — it's a commitment to the people of Texas ," said Alex Hagan , CEO of DriveSavers. "We're proud to be here, doing what we can to help this community recover." Eligible Devices Not Eligible Device How to Get Help About DriveSavers Data Recovery Since 1985, DriveSavers has helped more than 200,000 customers recover lost data safely and securely. As a trusted global leader, DriveSavers meets strict industry and government standards, including SOC 2 Type II and HIPAA compliance. Satisfied clients include Bank of America, Google, Lucasfilm, NASA, Harvard University , St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, the U.S. Army, and Sandia National Laboratories. title: Whitehorse council hits pause on Whitehorse North Trail Plan
creator: Talar Stockton, Local Journalism Initiative Reporter Yukon News
content: Whitehorse city council is postponing adopting the Whitehorse North trail plan until the middle of August. The trail plan, which serves the Hidden Valley and Macpherson subdivisons, proposes a number of motorized and non-motorized trails. Snowmobilers would be allowed to use the non-motorized trails in the winter. It was introduced at June 30’s council meeting. A previous version of the trail plan was adopted in 2022, but public concern over the public engagement process resulted in a renewed trail plan development. Coun. Anne Middler brought forward a motion to postpone the council vote on adoption to Aug. 11, the next city council meeting scheduled after the council’s summer recess. Middler cited her need for more time to gain information. The motion to postpone was passed unanimously, with support from every council member. The motion also followed a delegation from Hidden Valley resident Liz Reichenbach, who asked council to either vote against adoption of the trail plan, or to delay making a decision. Reichenbach said that the statistics shared at last week’s council meeting, which showed 67 per cent of survey respondents opposing banning snowmobiles, were an “inaccurate, skewed reflection of true supporters in favour of snowmobiles on non-motorized trails.” Reichenbach said that the survey questions didn’t have enough detail. She said that she had spoken with residents who preferred narrower trails. She said they would have opted for non-motorized trails without...

title: Rusia ataca a Ucrania con más de 700 drones, el mayor bombardeo de la guerra, según autoridades
creator: Por ILLIA NOVIKOV - Associated Press
content: KIEV, Ucrania (AP) — Rusia lanzó más de 700 drones de ataque y señuelos contra Ucrania durante la noche, superando las andanadas nocturnas anteriores por tercera vez en dos semanas, mientras Moscú intensifica su asalto aéreo y terrestre en la guerra que empezó hace más de tres años, dijeron el miércoles funcionarios ucranianos. Rusia ha buscado recientemente abrumar las defensas antiaéreas ucranianas con enormes ataques que incluyen un número creciente de drones señuelo. El más reciente parecía estar dirigido a interrumpir el suministro vital de armas occidentales a Ucrania. Lutsk, una ciudad que alberga aeródromos utilizados por el ejército ucraniano, fue la más afectada, según el presidente de Ucrania, Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Se encuentra cerca de la frontera con Polonia en el oeste de Ucrania, una región que es un centro crucial para recibir ayuda militar extranjera. El ataque se produce en un momento de creciente incertidumbre sobre el suministro de armas estadounidenses cruciales y mientras los esfuerzos de paz liderados por Estados Unidos se han estancado. Zelenskyy dijo que el Kremlin estaba "enviando un mensaje" con su andanada. El Ministerio ruso de Defensa dijo que sus fuerzas apuntaron a bases aéreas ucranianas y que "todos los objetivos designados han sido alcanzados". Mientras tanto, Ucrania lanzó drones en Rusia durante la noche, matando a tres personas en la región fronteriza de Kursk, incluido un niño de 5 años, dijo el gobernador local....

title: Trump budget cuts threaten accuracy of hurricane forecasts, scientists warn
content: The Trump administration’s proposed budget cuts to weather programs could damage the accuracy of hurricane forecasts, slowing or even reversing progress made in delivering storm warnings needed to keep Floridians safe, a group of retired scientists said Wednesday. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s budget request calls for the closure of a dozen weather research labs — including a premier one in Miami — along with other deep funding reductions. That could undermine advances in projecting how strong a hurricane will be when it makes landfall, said James Franklin, former branch chief of the hurricane specialist unit at the National Hurricane Center. “My fear is that we’re going to look back 25 years from now and say, ‘This is when the progress stopped’,” he said. Franklin and two other former government weather officials spoke at a Wednesday news conference, along with Democratic lawmakers seeking to highlight the proposed cuts ahead of the peak of hurricane season. The Miami lab performs “critical” functions for hurricane forecasting, such as manning hurricane hunter flights, processing radar data and launching ocean gliders to gather measurements, said Robert Atlas, director emeritus of NOAA’s Atlantic Oceanographic and Meteorology Laboratory. NOAA and the National Weather Service are already reeling from the loss of probationary employees who were terminated and staff members who took buyouts. That has resulted in fewer launches of weather balloons, which...

title: ‘It’s Too Expensive’: Eli Manning Passes Up On Opportunity To Buy Stake Of New York Giants
creator: Andrew Powell
content: The hierarchy couldn’t give him a discount? Originally interested, New York Giants legend Eli Manning has officially decided to pass on the opportunity to purchase an ownership stake in the franchise, stating that “it’s too expensive for me.” Back in February, the Giants announced that a limited stake in the franchise was going to be put up for sale, potentially up to 10%. And that the numbers were likely going to break records when it comes to the valuation of an NFL team. (RELATED: Dan Orlovsky Staying Put With ESPN After New Deal) The last valuation from Forbes has the Giants at $7.3 billion. CNBC has that amount at $7.85 billion. “Basically, it’s too expensive for me,” said Manning to CNBC Sport . “These numbers are getting very big. ... A 1% stake of something valued at $10 billion — it turns into a very big number. I love the Giants, and I think it is deserving of that valuation. There will be people that want to go for it, and I was kind of along for the ride.” Eli Manning says he’s no longer interested in buying a piece of the NFL’s Giants: ‘It’s too expensive for me’ https://t.co/6pahex6LO9 — CNBC (@CNBC) July 9, 2025 I get Eli Manning’s beef here, paying $1 billion for a 1% stake is straight up robbery, and it makes me think ... I get this is a business and everything, but they couldn’t give a franchise legend like Eli Manning a discount? It’s like, damn, if Eli isn’t even getting a break, who out here is?

title: Fakta Mayat Pria Ditemukan di Kali Ciliwung: Tanpa Kepala dan Alat Vital, Sempat Dikelilingi Biawak
Lawsuit blames oil companies for Washington state woman's 2021 heat wave death
creator: By Carleen Johnson | The Center Square
content: (The Center Square) – In what appears to be a first-of-its-kind lawsuit, big oil companies – including ExxonMobil, Chevron, BP and Shell – are facing a climate change wrongful death lawsuit from the family of a Seattle woman. The lawsuit , filed in King County Superior Court on May 28, alleges the oil companies knowingly fueled climate change and misled the public about the risks and consequences that the suit claims contributed to the record-high temperatures that blanketed western Washington in the final week of June 2021. Julie Leon died of hyperthermia on June 28, 2021, Seattle’s hottest day on record, when temperatures soared to 108 degrees. “On that day, Julie was overcome by heat while driving through Seattle with her windows rolled down. She managed to safely pull off the highway and onto a residential street before losing consciousness. Roughly two hours later, a good Samaritan discovered her, unresponsive and hot to the touch. First responders administered over a dozen rounds of CPR and other lifesaving measures but could not revive her,” the legal filing reads. The lawsuit contends the extreme heat that killed Leon was directly linked to fossil fuel-driven alteration of the climate. “Indeed, scientists have determined that an event as severe as the Heat Dome would have been ‘virtually impossible’ without anthropogenic warming,” according to the filing. title: MTL Manufacturing rides the power wave
creator: ALEX GARY alex.gary@apg-sw.com
content: BELOIT - A company launched 25 years ago in Milton with a $1,500 loan from a family member is the first and potentially only tenant of a 500,000-square-foot spec warehouse in the Gateway Business District. This past September, MTL Manufacturing began moving into the massive structure at 1901 Gateway Blvd. The company initially will take up about 150,000-square-feet of the building with plans to quickly occupy the entire building. MTL Manufacturing is not new to the area. The company has been part of the Beloit business community since 2010 and moved into about 30,000-square-feet of space on the Ironworks Campus nearly five years ago. Still, it's a significant investment for a company that started with a single welding station by Mike Nimmo. After graduating from Milton High School, Nimmo went to work for a metal fabrication shop. He stayed there until he was 29 when he decided he could "do this on my own." He borrowed $1,500 from his brother and got cheap space in an old building from a friend - then he started making phone calls. "You know, I was always trying for the big score, but really, at first I was just fixing a lot of tractor components," the now 54-year-old Nimmo said. His first big break came in 2001 when he got a contract from Lear Corp., a global automotive supplier that focuses on seating and electrical distribution systems. "A guy running a department got into a pinch on something and gave me the opportunity to rework some components," Nimmo said. "Next thing...

title: Local man reaches plea deal on drug charges
content: An Idaho Falls man signed a plea deal Wednesday with Bonneville County prosecutors on multiple drug charges stemming from a traffic stop last month. According to court records, Shawn Micheal Pelkowski, 40, was stopped at the intersection of Potomac Way and East Sunnyside Drive in Idaho Falls at 12:36 p.m. June 25 after Bonneville County Sheriff's deputies noted his vehicle failed to stop before turning and then made an improper lane change. After a K9 positively identified drugs being present, deputies initiated a search of the vehicle. They reported finding a brown box with 30 vape pens containing 60 grams of marijuana. A bag also located in the back seat held more than 15 grams of a substance that tested positive for MDMA, also known as ecstasy or molly. A second bag was found to hold more than 5.5 grams of LSD. Pelkowski was arrested and later charged with felony possession of a controlled substance with intent to deliver, felony possession of LSD, felony possession of MDMA and misdemeanor possession of marijuana. Pelkowski faced a maximum penalty of nine years imprisonment, fines of up to $21,000 and restitution. According to court documents, Pelkowski will plead guilty to the first two counts with the other counts being dismissed. The defendant does agree to pay full restitution on all charged and uncharged crimes. In response, the state will recommend he serve three months local jail time and probation. While the plea deal isn't binding on the court, Pelkowski...

title: Celebrated Montana Folk Festival returns Friday to Uptown Butte
creator: DUNCAN ADAMS duncan.adams@mtstandard.com
content: The Montana Folk Festival returns Friday to Uptown Butte, offering a weekend of free music performances across six stages and much more. The free event traces its origins to the storied National Folk Festival. Audience members dance to a performance during the Montana Folk Festival at the Granite Street stage on Saturday, July 13, 2024. In 1938, W. C. Handy, known as the "Father of the Blues," made his first appearance on a desegregated stage at a National Folk Festival held in Washington, D.C. A history of the National Folk Festival reports, “The festival presented black and white performers every year — and got away with it. How the festival managed this remains unclear to this day, but its organizers seem to have simply ignored the prohibition and the Daughters of the American Revolution never challenged them on it.” Ken Heath leans backwards after finishing a song with his band the True Disciples during the 2023 Montana Folk Festival in Butte. Nearly 90 years later, attendees at the annual Montana Folk Festival will likely revel in the multicultural mix of peoples and genres gracing stages in historic Uptown Butte. Romeo Bougere performs with the New Orleans musical group 79ers Gang on the Northwestern Energy Dance Pavilion stage during the Montana Folk Festival on Saturday, July 13, 2024. The festival begins Friday at 7 p.m. on the dramatic Main Stage at the Original Mineyard and ends Sunday at 5:30 p.m. with a sacred soul and gospel performance by Elizabeth King on the...

title: Suspect in fatal Austin hit-and-run killed in crash on I-35 in Round Rock
content: ROUND ROCK, Texas — A suspect who had been charged in a fatal May 6 hit-and-run crash in Austin died two months later in a separate crash on Interstate 35 in Round Rock, Travis County prosecutors have confirmed. Agustin Guillen, 38, was one of three people killed in the crash in the early morning hours of June 29. Round Rock police said three vehicles were involved, and their investigation led to the arrest of 22-year-old Kearra Thomas on suspicion of driving while intoxicated. Guillen was facing a felony charge of collision involving death for the May 6 crash in the 2900 block of North MoPac northbound that killed 47-year-old motorcyclist Shawn Oveisi. According to arrest documents, investigators believe Guillen hit Oveisi and ran away from the crash scene. He also later reported his car stolen, which police believe was a false report to evade responsibility for the crash. Police arrested Guillen on June 11, but he posted bond and was released the next day. The Round Rock crash happened around 2:30 a.m. on June 29. Arrest reports from Round Rock police indicate that Guillen was driving a silver Toyota and was involved in a single-vehicle rollover crash on I-35 near U.S. 79. Round Rock police believe two other victims – 48-year-old Maximo Ramirez and 21-year-old Quinn Stegall – exited their vehicles and were attempting to help Guillen. Police say that's when Thomas crashed into the overturned silver Toyota, killing both Ramirez and Stegall. Thomas is facing two counts of...

title: Después del gringo asesinado, Solesta refuerza sus medidas de seguridad
content: El centro comercial Solesta está tomando acciones para mejorar y reforzar las medidas de seguridad del centro comercial luego de que el pasado 4 de julio un cliente norteamericano fuera asesinado en el estacionamiento durante un asalto, informó Bernardo Bouffier, director general de esta plaza.El asalto ocurrió la noche del viernes 4 de julio en el centro comercial Solesta, en Puebla capital, en el que un turista extranjero, identificado como Stanley N., fue atacado en un intento de asalto para robar su reloj Cartier, en el área de estacionamiento subterráneo por dos hombres en motocicleta, resultando en el fallecimiento del norteamericano pocas horas después en el Hospital Puebla. Únete a nuestro canal de WhatsApp para mantenerte informado al estilo de DIARIO CAMBIOEn este sentido, Bouffier destacó que el problema del incremento de inseguridad no solo es exclusivo de la zona Angelópolis, sino en todo el país, sin embargo, enfatizó que se tienen que tomar medidas de prevención para evitar situaciones de agresión y violencia.“La inseguridad está terrible en el país y en el estado. Se hace lo que se puede y sí estamos tomando medidas, pero todo a su tiempo. Somos una seguridad de prevención y sí existe coordinación”, agregó el empresario.Por su parte, la Secretaria de Seguridad Pública informó en días pasados que se presume que los agresores forman parte de una banda criminal de origen colombiano dedicada al robo de relojes de alta gama.De igual manera,...

title: Valkyries rout the Fever as Caitlin Clark struggles in her return from injury
creator: The Associated Press
content: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — Veronica Burton had 21 points, eight rebounds and six assists, Kayla Thornton added 18 points and eight boards, and the Golden State Valkyries beat the Indiana Fever 80-61 on Wednesday to spoil Caitlin Clark’s return. The Valkyries held Clark to just 10 points on 4-of-12 shooting as the Fever scored their second-fewest points of the season. Clark returned after missing the past five games with a left groin injury. The All-Star captain participated in practice Monday — the first time she’d done that since getting hurt on June 26. Golden State led 41-32 at halftime and Kate Martin scored five consecutive points in the third for a 15-point lead. SUN 93, STORM 83 UNCASVILLE, Conn. (AP) — Tina Charles set season highs with 29 points and 11 rebounds to help Connecticut end a 10-game losing streak with a victory over Seattle. Connecticut (3-16) won its first game since June 6. Charles made a baseline jumper with 5:36 left in the fourth quarter to give Connecticut its first lead of the game at 79-77. Charles also made two layups in eight seconds — following a steal by Saniya Rivers — for a 91-81 lead. The Sun pulled away by scoring 11 straight points late in the fourth. Charles finished 11 of 22 from the field for her sixth 20-point game of the season. Jacy Sheldon added 16 points and Bria Hartley had 15. Rivers scored all 11 of her points in the opening five minutes of the third. Skylar Diggins led Seattle (13-7) with 23 points and seven assists. Gabby Williams...

title: Police investigating death of Maine paddleboarder as a homicide after discovery of body
creator: By ROBERT F. BUKATY and PATRICK WHITTLE - Associated Press
content: UNION, Maine (AP) — Police in Maine are investigating the death of a paddleboarder near a campground in rural Maine as a homicide and asking the public for help finding the killer. The body of Sunshine Stewart, 48, of Tenants Harbor, Maine, was found Thursday on Crawford Pond in Union. The manner of death was determined to be a homicide, though the cause of death is not being released to the public yet, Maine State Police said in a statement. Police have asked that anyone who may have seen Stewart paddleboarding on July 2 between 6 p.m. and 9 p.m. near 100 Acre Island on Crawford Pond contact them. Maine State Police said in a Wednesday evening statement it remains "steadfast in our efforts to investigate" the killing. Stewart lived about a half hour from the pond, which is a popular summer destination about 15 miles (24 kilometers) from the scenic coastal areas of the state's midcoast region. Friends and family who gathered at Stewart’s home on Wednesday declined to comment. Crawford Pond is located in the 2,400-resident town of Union, about 80 miles (129 kilometers) northeast of Portland, the largest city in the state. The area is popular with campers and daytrippers. The pond is approximately 600 acres (243 hectares) and does not have public access. It is available for a variety of uses, including boating and fishing. The 100 Acre Island preserve in the center of the pond is a wooded island reachable by canoe, kayak or paddleboard from a nearby campground. The lake has...

creator: By Granite State Gaming & Hospitality
content: ROCHESTER, N.H. , July 9, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Granite State Gaming & Hospitality is proud to announce a strategic partnership with Gaming Analytics , a leading provider of AI-powered analytics for the gaming and hospitality industry. This collaboration will bring cutting-edge data technology to both of Granite State's premier properties— Lilac Club Casino in Rochester and Beach Club Casino in Hampton Beach—enhancing guest experiences and optimizing operational efficiency across the board. This move represents a significant step in Granite State Gaming & Hospitality's mission to blend traditional casino excitement with next-generation innovation. By implementing Gaming Analytics' advanced platform, both casinos will gain real-time insights into player behavior, allowing for personalized guest engagement, smarter promotional targeting, and streamlined staffing and floor operations. "Our guests deserve the best experience possible—from the moment they walk in to their final hand of the night," said Eric Barbaro , COO of Granite State Gaming & Hospitality. "By partnering with Gaming Analytics, we're equipping our teams at both Lilac Club and Beach Club with tools to truly understand and anticipate player preferences. This is about delivering smarter service, more engaging rewards, and creating entertainment destinations that feel personalized and unforgettable." title: Trump budget cuts threaten accuracy of hurricane forecasts, scientists warn
content: The Trump administration’s proposed budget cuts to weather programs could damage the accuracy of hurricane forecasts, slowing or even reversing progress made in delivering storm warnings needed to keep Floridians safe, a group of retired scientists said Wednesday. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s budget request calls for the closure of a dozen weather research labs — including a premier one in Miami — along with other deep funding reductions. title: Woman arrested for DUI after driving SUV on Centennial Trail
creator: tansures@kxly.com (Taylar Ansures)
content: SPOKANE VALLEY, Wash. -- A woman was arrested for driving an SUV on the Centennial Trail while under the influence. According to the Spokane County Sheriff's Office, 61-year-old Maureen G. Mortlock was driving west on the trail near East Trent Avenue at around 9:10 p.m. on Saturday. Deputies deployed spike strips ahead of the SUV and yelled at Mortlock to stop while using flashlights to show where they were. Mortlock ignored the deputies and drove over the spikes. She continued to drive on the trail with deflated tires. Deputies chased her on foot while yelling at her to stop. SCSO said there were several pedestrians, including children, on or near the trail at this time. Mortlock eventually stopped and was told to put her SUV in park. SCSO said Mortlock was fumbling around and seemed to have problems putting the car into park. When Mortlock got out of her car, she appeared unsteady and smelled of alcohol. Mortlock was detained and showed more signs that she was under the influence while speaking with deputies. She told deputies she was new to the area and trying to find her way home. Mortlock denied drinking any alcohol that night. SCSO said Mortlock agreed to do a field sobriety test. After the test, Mortlock was arrested for DUI. A breath test showed Mortlock's blood alcohol level at 0.150 and 0.147. The legal BAC limit is 0.08. Mortlock was booked into the Spokane County Jail for DUI and reckless driving. title: Spokane Zephyr sign former Zag Kelsey Oyler
creator: Jwallace@kxly.com (Jack Wallace)
content: SPOKANE, Wash. - The Spokane Zephyr continue to fill out their 2025-26 season roster, and they add a key defender in Kelsey Oyler. The three-time Idaho Player of the Year dominated in Meridian before a West Coast Conference Championship-winning run with the Gonzaga Bulldogs. Oyler transferred to the Arkansas Razorbacks, reaching the Sweet 16 of the NCAA Tournament her senior season in 2024. Spokane opens their season at Dallas Trinity FC on August 23. title: Why the ‘Superman Curse’ Still Casts a Shadow Ahead of New Movie Release
content: With the hitting theaters on July 11, there are some who are worried the franchise’s “curse” might rear its ugly head. The legend of the “Superman Curse” originated after one of the superhero’s creators, Jerry Siegel, promised to curse the character after he barely made a penny off of its creation. Siegel, and co-creator Joe Schuster sold the rights to DC Comics for just $130 in 1938. The men agreed to a work-for-hire contract that allowed DC to pay them once the comic was published. However, the deal meant that the company could profit off of anything created with Superman, including merch, movies and more, but they had no obligation to pay Siegel and Schuster anything. Afterward, Siegel allegedly told one of the DC executives that he’d “put a curse on him.” Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content. Thanks for the feedback.

title: Tugas 'Berat' Arya Daru di Kemenlu, Ikut Evakuasi WNI di Irak hingga Bopong Anak Telantar di Taiwan
content: Direktur Perlindungan WNI Kementerian Luar Negeri (Kemenlu), , melayat ke rumah duka Diplomat Muda, , di Kabupaten Bantul, DI Yogyakarta, Rabu (9/7/2025). Dalam kesempatan itu, Judha mengungkapkan kinerja Daru selama bersama . Daru yang sudah menjadi pegawai sejak 2014, bergabung dengan Direktorat Perlindungan WNI pada 2022. Judha mengatakan Daru kerap terlibat dalam tugas-tugas berat terkait WNI di luar negeri. Daru, ungkap Judha, terlibat dalam proses evakuasi WNI di Irak, saat Timur Tengah sedang memanas buntut konflik Iran vs Israel beberapa waktu lalu. "Mas Daru turun mengevakuasi WNI di Turki beberapa waktu lalu. Terakhir, Daru juga mengevakuasi WNI di Irak," jelas Judha, Rabu, dikutip dari Tak hanya itu, imbuh Judha, pihaknya juga menyaksikan sendiri bagaimana Daru membopong anak-anak telantar di Taiwan untuk kembali ke Indonesia. "Kami sendiri melihat bagaimana Mas Daru membopong anak-anak telantar di Taiwan, kembali ke Indonesia," lanjutnya. Judha menyebut Daru sedianya akan bertugas di Helsinki, Finlandia, pada akhir Juli 2025. Namun, penugasan tersebut berujung gagal sebab Daru ditemukan tewas di kosannya di kawasan , , Selasa (7/8/2025) pagi. Lebih lanjut, Judha mengungkapkan Daru adalah sosok yang rendah hati dan suka menolong. Kepribadiannya itu membuat Daru dekat dengan senior ataupun juniornya di . title: Big 12 notebook: Gundy thinks his video-game look is a cut above, players disagree
content: FRISCO — You can make a case that Mike Gundy has the most famous hair in college football. You can also make a case that “College Football ’26,” the latest video game offering from EA Sports, didn’t get that hair quite right. The popular game added head coaches to its mix this year. Naturally, that sparked some commentary about the accuracy of the coaches’ likenesses. Gundy, the veteran Oklahoma State coach who is approaching his 21st season with the Cowboys, has become well-known in recent years for sporting a mullet. EA Sports appeared to try to replicate that look, only to unveil something that screamed more “Welcome Back, Kotter” than Florida Georgia Line. “Oh my gosh, that afro?” said Cowboys tight end Josh Ford. “I know what they were trying to go for, but I don’t know who that was supposed to be.” Oklahoma State head coach Mike Gundy, the dean of Big 12 coaches, said he liked the look of his video-game character in “College Football ‘26.” OSU defensive back Cam Smith agreed that EA Sports may have missed the mark with Gundy’s signature hairdo. “The video game did him crazy. I can’t lie,” Smith said. “We talked about it earlier. I can see what they were going for, but I think they missed it just a little bit, a little bit.” For his part, Gundy said he was a fan of his video game self. “I have not played the game, but I think it’s pretty cool that somebody put me in a video game,” Gundy said. “Somebody showed me a picture recently, and they gave me a great hairdo. Like,...

title: Power City Eatery owner announces plan to close Third Street business
creator: Staff reports
content: The owner of Power City Eatery on Third Street announced Wednesday afternoon that the business will soon shut its doors. In a post on Facebook , Joe Hotchkiss said there isn’t a firm closing date for the business at 444 Third St., but, “we know it’s coming sooner rather than later.” Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content.
